title: Mission Description
content: Wesense that Trianne used her divine power again.We'reworried about her... Agy notices our concern and suggestsweall go to the baths to unwind.

text: Some time before, in the Marmoreal Palace ...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Trianne ...?

speaker: Aglaea
line: What's wrong...? Is there trouble at the Grove ?

speaker: Tribbie
line: ▶ Yes, I sensed something... It was fleeting, but very strong... It feels like they're in some big trouble.

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Trianne used the Century Gate again.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Can you see what's actually happening?

speaker: Tribbie
line: ▶ No. It's fuzzy like always, but the enemy's aura has disappeared. Maybe... they've moved to a safe place...?

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ Let's hope that it's just a false alarm. We should place our trust in ( Trailblazer ) and Castorice , teacher...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ ...They will keep Trianne safe.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy, you're talking like we are little kids.

speaker: Tribbie
line: One day, Trianne will reach her limit, and Tribbie will take on the role of gatekeeper from her — *we* are all aware of that.

speaker: Tribbie
line: I am just... a little concerned about her state of mind. Trianne was already unable to speak even in short sentences when they left...

speaker: Tribbie
line: We want to say a proper goodbye at the very least.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...I will pray with you.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Thanks. And Agy, it looks like we will need you to come with us to the baths this time to unwind...

speaker: Tribbie
line: It feels like neither of us have laughed for a long while.

text: Head to the baths with Aglaea

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's time to head out with the west wind!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Alright.

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...The air's really hot and heavy. Has it always been like this?

text: (Once the marked location is within view)

speaker: Tribbie
line: Is someone... injured over there?

speaker: Lightheaded Bath Customer
line: Ugh...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Wh—What happened here?

speaker: Lightheaded Bath Customer
line: Watch... out...

speaker: Lightheaded Bath Customer
line: Watch out... for the Kremnoan...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Kremnoan? This is... their doing?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy, now's not the time to dwell on that. Let's help the injured people first!

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...Excuse me! Coming through!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Oh, you two are here as well! That's a relief.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Even the Twilight Courtyard is involved? What in the world happened here?

speaker: Hyacine
line: I actually just came to relax... But as soon as I got here, I saw all these people lying on the ground.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I've examined them, and they don't seem to be seriously ill. It feels like... they've just spent too much time in the hot water.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Multiple individuals fainting simultaneously from the hot pool's steam? Where is the manager of the baths?

speaker: Hyacine
line: He disappeared, and no one knows where he's gone to. Some people have been saying that the Kremnoans are behind this... Lady Aglaea, what do you think about this?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Let these people rest. The two of you, please come with me.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Have you thought of something, Agy?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Yes. While their intentions elude me, it's time to bring this farce to a close.

title: Step Description
content: Multiple visitors suddenly pass out in the baths. Hyacine's examination shows an unexpected reason: overheated water. But who is the culprit...?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Oh! This many people...!?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Who in the world did this...?

speaker: Mydei
line: This is all you can do, huh? Pitiable "Deliverer."

speaker: Tribbie
line: D-De!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Snowy! Even Snowy...

speaker: Phainon
line: The... culprit...

speaker: Phainon
line: The culprit... is... Mydeimos...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Ugh!

speaker: Tribbie
line: De! What did you do to everybody!?

speaker: Mydei
line: Tch... It's just another duel where I claimed victory.

speaker: Hyacine
line: D-Duel?

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...As I expected.

speaker: Aglaea
line: On the surface, these two are the mightiest warriors in the holy city, but they're still impulsive youths at heart...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Speak up, Mydei. Tell us exactly what kind of foolishness you and Phainon indulged in this time.

text: (How's your recovery coming along, my friend?)
(Winning and losing are all part of a warrior's life. Don't let it get to you.)
(Why don't you take a bath to recharge, buddy?)

speaker: Mydei
line: (No. None of those sound right.)

text: (Keep your chin up. You have greater things to achieve.)
(Want to grab a drink with me, pal?)
(If you're up for it, let's have a talk.)

speaker: Mydei
line: (...Forget it.)

text: I see you still alive and kicking, Deliverer.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Am I seeing things? Is the magnificent Deliverer finally deigning to step outside?

speaker: Phainon
line: Hmph.

speaker: Mydei
line: "Hmph"...? What kind of response is that?

speaker: Phainon
line: Nothing. I was just imitating your usual response.

speaker: Phainon
line: I don't feel anything special from you... Have you passed the demigod trial?

speaker: Mydei
line: The ritual hasn't reopened yet. In case you forgot — It hasn't been THAT long since I pulled you out of the trial.

speaker: Phainon
line: I didn't forget.

speaker: Mydei
line: Then, you're welcome.

speaker: Phainon
line: "In twilight's last gleam, Okhema stands bold. Her walls sturdy, tales untold."

speaker: Phainon
line: "Dreaming of her fruitful gardens, pilgrims arrive from distant lands. Figs and olives, O so grand..."

speaker: Phainon
line: "...Yet little do they know, that they will step into flames, fuel to the fire, a burning brand."

speaker: Mydei
line: What are you playing at this time?

speaker: Phainon
line: I just felt like reciting a few lines of poetry. Surely the crown prince of Kremnos knows how to appreciate poetry, right?

speaker: Mydei
line: Kremnoans steer clear of such weak literature, but my library doesn't lack collections of this kind —

speaker: Phainon
line: These lines express the poet's yearning for their home, just as Okhema is distant from many people's homes.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...I know how to interpret poetry, HKS .

speaker: Phainon
line: Ha... There's no point in pretending to be profound, my friend. Thank you for helping me out when I was in a tight spot, but it seems to me that you aren't prepared for the trial either.

speaker: Mydei
line: Don't compare your situation with mine. My people are still relying on me. I can't ascend to godhood on my own without first resolving their issues.

speaker: Phainon
line: So... are you suggesting that you, the mighty Mydeimos and the heir to the throne of Kremnos, wish to defy the tradition that has endured among your people for millennia?

speaker: Mydei
line: I'm still thinking about what I should do.

speaker: Phainon
line: Never mind. It's probably not my place to offer you counsel.

speaker: Phainon
line: An idea does strike me, though...

speaker: Mydei
line: Go ahead. Let's see what terrible ideas you've come up with this time.

speaker: Phainon
line: Maybe we both need to relieve some stress. Come, Mydeimos! Let's recommence our previous competition...

speaker: Phainon
line: This time... We'll see who can stay in the super hot bath for longer!

speaker: Phainon
line: What? Are you chickening out?

speaker: Mydei
line: The phrase "chickening out" does not exist in the Kremnoan language. I just find the situation absurd, that's all. All-knowing historian, are you not aware that we Kremnoans use boiling water from sword forging for our baths?

speaker: Mydei
line: Looks like I'll have to teach you some royal etiquette today!

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: And thus, an unprecedented sauna battle commences.

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: With unparalleled resolve, the two warriors' determination even alters the very hue of the steam. Flames intertwine with scalding vapor, reaching toward the heavens, shrouding the sky and the sun. The spectacle is so magnificent that none dare gaze upon it directly...

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: Since we can't see what's happening in the competition... Why don't I regale you with a tale of "kings" to pass the time?

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: Do you recall the legend of the " Gorgo Lion " mentioned by a certain veteran ? The central figure — the "mane" character — was not the sole sovereign of that land. An oryx stood as its formidable rival.

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: Long before the dawn of Era Chrysea , the two beasts started their timeless battle on the plains of Tretos . The lion regarded the oryx as its food, while the oryx perceived the lion as a scornful, oppressive, and challenging barrier that it swore to topple with its antlers...

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: For tens of thousands of years, without respite, the two creatures thus continued their relentless pursuit and rivalry...

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: It fixated on its rival's fleeing form in the chase.

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: It set its sights on the other's neck, nearly within reach.

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: It was stuck in a corner.

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: It had nowhere to escape.

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: On the land of Amphoreus , some lives meet their end at dusk, some at dawn, and yet others... are fated to perish under the blistering sun at noon!

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: And at last, the most scorching moment of the day descended upon them! The formidable hand of fate heeded their call and arrived...

speaker: Bath Attendant Daros
line: My lords, would you like me to reduce the temperature a little?

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph...

speaker: Phainon
line: Wh—What? Heh... You're chickening out already?

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Get lost.

speaker: Bath Attendant Daros
line: A-Are you asking me to get lost? Or...

speaker: Mydei
line: Do... whatever... you want...

speaker: Bath Attendant Daros
line: ...Please forgive my presumptuousness, my lords.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...What a spectacle of folly.

speaker: Mydei
line: This is what you get for daring to challenge a Kremnoan without understanding your own place.

speaker: Aglaea
line: What I'm saying is... Your little game dragged down quite a few innocent souls alongside you.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...We will personally escort back home the customers left awestruck by our formidable presence.

speaker: Phainon
line: This... This isn't fair...

speaker: Phainon
line: You are wearing... way less... than I am...

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...Is this the latest trend now? Getting into the baths while dressed in full armor?

speaker: Mydei
line: Don't look at me like that... It was he who challenged me. There is no word for "flee" in the Kremnoan language.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Very well, let us bring this farce to a close, shall we? Warriors, it is time to get moving.

text: After recovery, Phainon and Mydei escorted the fainted bathers away from the scene.
This time, Phainon narrowly triumphed with a stunning 27 to 25 victory in terms of the number of trips safely escorted.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Alas... The Flame-Chase Journey is destined to be a lengthy one, replete with obstacles.

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...But thanks to those two, all the gloom has vanished into thin air.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Though we just had quite the commotion, it's not every day that we find the Marmoreal Palace this serene. Shall we continue with our previous plans? Hyacine, would you care to join us?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Such an empty bath is indeed a rare sight...

speaker: Hyacine
line: I was looking forward to unwinding after work. I'd be delighted to accept your invitation, Lady Tribbie!

speaker: Tribbie
line: How about we go to the biggest bath?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Let me check... The water temperature feels just perfect!

speaker: Aglaea
line: So, how is the feeling of having the entire bath to yourselves?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Heehee, it's sooo good...

speaker: Hyacine
line: But, Lady Tribbie... Aren't you going to soak in the bath with us?

speaker: Tribbie
line: We will have to pass. After all, we* ve become children.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Please understand that she can no longer endure the heat of this pool due to the blessings of Janus .

speaker: Hyacine
line: Oh...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Are you curious about us , Hyacine?

speaker: Hyacine
line: I am, but something tells me... that it might be better to change the topic?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Don't get all nervous. It's not something we can't discuss! The truth is... a long, long time ago... we were a mature adult just like Agy.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Then, because of reasons... we inherited Janus ' divinity and gained the power of "Passage"...

speaker: Tribbie
line: And in return, the price we had to pay was the splitting of our soul .

speaker: Aglaea
line: Each opening of the Century Gate intensifies the strain on Tribbie and the others. They are gradually regressing towards infancy, both in body and mind.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We don't know what awaits us at the end, either. But anyway, that's why we have turned into children.

speaker: Hyacine
line: In that case... when you opened that giant Century Gate above Okhema during the battle against Nikador ...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Well, there's no way around it. We all know that the Flame-Chase Journey won't be a smooth ride.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Maybe... We can find a way to fix it. The primary research focus of Nousporists is the soul. We explore its depletion and methods to restore dispersed souls... As long as research continues, there might be a breakthrough that can help.

speaker: Hyacine
line: We will do everything we can.

speaker: Aglaea
line: So, your first reaction is in fact denial? You're indeed Anaxa's student.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I look forward to your good news, Hyacine.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Haha, now there's another reason to look forward to tomorrow...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Ugh!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lady Tribbie!? Wh—What's wrong?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Something's... off. It's that strong feeling again... Is it Trianne?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Wait, no... It's not Trianne this time...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...It's Trinnon ! Trinnon is in danger...!

title: Step Description
content: Following a ridiculous contest, Phainon and Mydei stop to rest. The two warriors discuss the Coreflame trial, revealing untold stories from their pasts...

speaker: Phainon
line: Ha, I win this round of escorting the bathers home.

speaker: Mydei
line: How does one contender alone make a valid competition?

speaker: Phainon
line: Offering a compliment or two wouldn't be the end of you, you know.

speaker: Mydei
line: ... HKS .

speaker: Phainon
line: Hai... What is that word? Is it your native tongue?

speaker: Mydei
line: It means "hyena" — I'm likening you to a weak hyena. By the way, you emphasized the completely wrong syllable.

speaker: Phainon
line: Though we've been acquainted for some time, I have... rarely heard you talk in the ancient tongue of Kremnos.

speaker: Mydei
line: It's because I'm not exactly a master at it, either. I can listen and read just fine, but when it comes to writing...

speaker: Phainon
line: You can write?

speaker: Mydei
line: You speak as if you don't have a brain.

speaker: Phainon
line: Haha, that was in jest. I understand. After all, you... spent all your childhood wandering far from home.

speaker: Mydei
line: Worry about yourself first, Deliverer. You also never mention your hometown apart from when you need to introduce yourself.

speaker: Phainon
line: Well... It's because there isn't much to say. Aedes Elysiae is simply a tiny village that disappeared many years ago in the flames of war.

speaker: Phainon
line: The only times I get to see it are in my dreams... and in...

speaker: Mydei
line: And in?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...And in the trial from the Lance of Fury .

speaker: Mydei
line: I knew it.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes, I saw it all. Aedes Elysiae ablaze, with everyone — my family, friends, and my kin — lying in a sea of flames.

speaker: Phainon
line: A blood-red half-sun hung in the sky, just like on that day. And before my eyes, that murderer ...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...killed Cyrene .

speaker: Phainon
line: But I saw its form this time... A black cloak, an eerie mask, and a broken giant sword that carried an ominous aura...

speaker: Phainon
line: I fought it in the trial. But even though I've been fighting, improving, and resolutely getting stronger all this time... I still couldn't defeat it.

speaker: Mydei
line: You were blinded by hatred and almost lost yourself in that trial.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's right... And that's why I am truly thankful to you, Mydeimos.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph, you've finally picked up some manners. Better late than never.

speaker: Phainon
line: Then what about you, Mydei? What did you see in that trial? ...What do you fear?

speaker: Mydei
line: There is no word for "fear" in the Kremnoan language.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I'm getting the feeling that your language has no words at all.

speaker: Mydei
line: But to answer your question, I saw Okhema in the trial, as well as...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...My old comrades.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hephaestion , Perdikkas , Leonnius , Ptolemy , and Peucesta ... Ever since I returned from the Sea of Souls, these five had been by my side.

speaker: Mydei
line: We faced life and death together during our days in exile. Those ten years were arduous, yet filled with moments worth treasuring. Each night, we would gather by the campfire, savoring honey brews and singing our hearts out...

speaker: Mydei
line: The wind in the wilds of Amphoreus smells like rust. Hephaestion would always tease me about adding goat milk to the honey brew, claiming I ruined the blood-red color of the drink. He had a scrawny figure, but was a relentless force on the battlefield, dispatching foes without so much as a blink.

speaker: Mydei
line: Perdikkas was an expert in concocting medicines, delving into all those strange folk remedies. Leonnius was a swift runner and our most reliable messenger.

speaker: Mydei
line: Ptolemy was a real bookworm, always spouting off in chapters and verses. When we left Kremnos, he made off with a stack of ancient tomes from the grand library — not like it mattered, since my family owns the library. And then there was Peucesta... Heh, he was the silent type, but a truly masterful musician...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...This is the first time I've heard you mention these five and their names.

speaker: Mydei
line: They died on the battlefield before the Kremnoan detachment managed to join Okhema.

speaker: Mydei
line: Perdikkas was the first to go. He was shot in the stomach by a poisonous arrow from the people of Ladon in the second Month of Cultivation . In the end, his remedies mended all but himself.

speaker: Perdikkas
line: "Mydeimos, do not mourn. I have achieved honor by bestowing a noble death upon the enemy..."

speaker: Mydei
line: Leonnius died in the fifth winter. Aidonia 's snowstorm lasted three full months. On the night of the fiercest storm, our foes launched their assault.

speaker: Phainon
line: Aidonia... Is that the city Castorice used to live in?

speaker: Mydei
line: Yes. Those zealots were as fearless as Kremnoans in the face of death, but they lacked respect for honor.

speaker: Mydei
line: They cornered us in a bottomless swamp. Leonnius covered for our retreat, and they cut his legs off. He vanished into the mire of a foreign land, his body never to be recovered.

speaker: Leonnius
line: "This is perfect, Mydeimos... I can finally deliver the news of you ascending the throne to the nether realm..."

speaker: Mydei
line: Twenty dusks later, we finally breached the walls of Aidonia and entertained the Usurper's plea for peace. However, the rebels refused to surrender and set up an ambush within the city...

speaker: Mydei
line: Ptolemy and his cavalry met their end before they could even relish our triumph. Those obelisks that collapsed after being set on fire became their final resting place.

speaker: Ptolemy
line: "Mydeimos, please tell my family: It was not cunning schemes that vanquished Ptolemy, but the immense weight of Amphoreus' entire history."

speaker: Mydei
line: Then, it was Peucesta. He lured the enemies into the city of Aenionus with his melodies, buying us invaluable time.

speaker: Mydei
line: Our enemies, consumed by indignation when they discovered the trick, set the entire city and my soldiers on fire... His final words were recorded on a small clay tablet, fractured by the flames.

speaker: Peucesta
line: "Mydeimos, don the crown."

speaker: Mydei
line: And at last, my most trusted friend, Hephaestion... He was supposed to stand by my side through it all, but a sudden relapse of his illness hit him on the eve of my duel against my father ...

speaker: Mydei
line: He hid his condition from me, and by the time I returned victorious, he had but a breath left in him.

speaker: Hephaestion
line: "A Kremnoan dying on a sickbed... I would be a laughingstock to everyone."

speaker: Mydei
line: "Hephaestion, my dear friend... Spare your strength. I'll go get a physician..."

speaker: Hephaestion
line: "No need... Even if Perdikkas were here, he couldn't stop destiny from taking me away."

speaker: Mydei
line: "No! None can take you away!"

speaker: Hephaestion
line: "Mydeimos... Our king... Do not shed tears for me. It's not befitting of your status."

speaker: Hephaestion
line: "Farewell, my dear friend... You must... lead us back home..."

text: Observe Tribbie interrupting Phainon and Mydei's conversation

speaker: Phainon
line: ...What a grave trial indeed.

speaker: Phainon
line: Now I understand why you see "immortality" as a defect... or even a curse.

speaker: Mydei
line: My father threw me into the Sea of Souls to break the wheel of karma, but little did he realize it would grant me an immortal body and summon a fated revenge on his head.

speaker: Mydei
line: Following his demise, I considered leading my people back to our homeland, but Kremnos had already turned into a wasteland. Only darkness and insanity thrived there.

speaker: Mydei
line: Against the dissent of many — Krateros included — I made the Kremnoan detachment stay in Okhema, but I know that their glory will never be doused out.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...The instant of "Strife" shall inevitably arrive.

speaker: Phainon
line: If you take over Nikador , then you must begin the journey back to your homeland.

speaker: Phainon
line: So... You hesitate because you think leaving your people in the holy city is a better choice?

speaker: Mydei
line: I don't know.

speaker: Mydei
line: But I have never been crowned, and those five were never endowed with any titles... None is aware of their glory.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Your predicament is truly complicated.

speaker: Phainon
line: I don't know how I can give you any useful advice. Maybe... you could seek counsel from more people, such as the Grand Craftsman? Chartonus' people seem to have been through comparable dilemmas.

speaker: Phainon
line: And that teacher of yours, Krateros...

speaker: Tribbie
line: De! We've got a big problem! Big problem!!!

speaker: Phainon
line: Lady Tribbie? What's making you so flustered?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Hurry up and go save Trinnon! She... She...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...She got abducted by Krateros!

title: Step Description
content: Krateros' stubborn persistence once again brings the fate and future of the Kremnoan people before you...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Krateros! What's going on?

speaker: Krateros
line: Ah, Mydeimos...

speaker: Krateros
line: It seems I was the one who exposed my vulnerabilities first... Heh.

speaker: Mydei
line: Aglaea! I demand an explanation.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This man abducted Trinnon by force and forced her to bring him to the Vortex of Genesis .

speaker: Aglaea
line: He then brazenly stepped into the trial of the Lance of Fury ... And naturally, failed.

speaker: Mydei
line: Is she telling the truth? Why did you do that?

speaker: Krateros
line: Because I don't want to wait anymore. Your hesitation made me desperate.

speaker: Krateros
line: If you want to run away from your destiny to become king, then keep running. Someone will eventually stand up and fill in the gap left by Strife... Then they will lead our people home.

speaker: Mydei
line: Age has blinded you, teacher!

speaker: Mydei
line: Can't you see that I'm hesitating because of this very recklessness seared into your blood?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Krateros, do you truly believe you're worthy of entering the trial? To blaspheme against the prophecy?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Does the mission we Chrysos Heirs bear seem like child's play to you?

speaker: Krateros
line: Do you know how the Kremnoans see you, Aglaea?

speaker: Krateros
line: You're a hypocrite... and a megalomaniac! The prophecy of genesis and the Flame-Chase Journey are just excuses for you to seize power.

speaker: Mydei
line: Silence, Krateros! Do you even know what you're saying?

speaker: Krateros
line: Are you defending this woman, Mydeimos? How many wars did people start because of her and her so-called prophecy? How many cities fell in the past millennium, their people massacring each other?

speaker: Krateros
line: Even if this so-called "genesis" really exists, will there be a place for the Kremnoans in that new world?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Are you done talking?

speaker: Aglaea
line: By agreement between the Chrysos Heirs and the Council of Elders , those who trespass upon the Vortex of Genesis need not be tried by the Council. I am allowed to pass judgment alone.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Krateros, your actions are unforgivable. I hereby sentence you...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy, wait!

speaker: Tribbie
line: ... We have a proposal. Someone has to resolve this conflict between the cities.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Lord Krateros did not use violence to harm us . We can sense that his anxiety stems from his concern for his people's future.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Please, Aglaea. Hear us out first.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I'm listening.

speaker: Trinnon
line: I'm sorry, Lord Krateros. We were so preoccupied with deciphering the fragments of prophecy that we neglected those of you not favored by its message... Your accusations were harsh but justified.

speaker: Trinnon
line: We wish to earn your trust, and those of the Kremnoans. I think the best way to do that... is to take you to witness the source of the prophecy for yourself.

speaker: Krateros
line: ...How are you going to show me something that has no form?

speaker: Trinnon
line: ▶ You've heard about that outlander, right? ( He / She ) has somehow made a connection with Oronyx and can completely replicate scenes from the past.

speaker: Trinnon
line: ▶ We will ask for ( his / her ) aid. Tomorrow, at the Abyss of Fate in the Temple of Janusopolis... we will show you everything from that distant memory, Krateros.

speaker: Krateros
line: ...A fair proposal. I accept.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Until then, you will be stripped of your freedom. That is my one condition and I will brook no argument.

speaker: Krateros
line: Hmph, it is not the first time I've been made someone else's prisoner. Do as you please, "demigod."

speaker: Mydei
line: Teacher... why did you do this?

speaker: Krateros
line: Forgive me, young master, but I just cannot wait any longer.

speaker: Krateros
line: Ever since your father died, our people and I have been waiting for a day to revive Kremnos. We placed all of our hopes in you but never received an answer.

speaker: Mydei
line: This obsession for returning home has become a sickness for our people! Wise as you are, I refuse to believe that you can't see the truth...

speaker: Krateros
line: You have a clear head, which is why you're also incomparably alone. A smart person can only choose to tangle himself with the mundane of this world.

speaker: Krateros
line: If you're truly capable of leading our people beyond this bloodstained fate, then prove it to me once more, Mydeimos.

speaker: Krateros
line: Just as you did back then...

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: A fierce fighter... I did not expect such heroism from a feeble Okheman.

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: Fulfill your duty as the victor, warrior, and tell me your name! I seek an honorable death from you!

speaker: Mydei
line: As if you have any honor!

speaker: Mydei
line: Listen closely! I am the leader of the Kremnoan detachment — Mydeimos !

speaker: Mydei
line: I'm here to finish you, father.

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: It is you... the beast spurned by all. So, you did defy death. The prophecy was true... You will bring an end to my Kremnoan dynasty.

speaker: Mydei
line: Defy? You're wrong. Death fears me. It's the reason I have this body of steel.

speaker: Mydei
line: As for you, you already stand at death's door, father. You were the one who threw me into the Sea of Souls, the one who tried in vain to enslave a Titan , and the one who desecrated the body of a god...

speaker: Mydei
line: HKS ! You're a weak king! So weak that even the lowliest hyena is a more noble existence than you!

speaker: Mydei
line: And now, fate's reckoning is upon you!

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: Then swing your blade! Take my crown, coronate yourself with an old king's blood, and inherit it all... Become the new rightful king of Kremnos.

speaker: Mydei
line: No, I don't want the crown. Listen — If there's only one end for the kings of Kremnos, then the crown means nothing to me...

speaker: Mydei
line: All I want is your life! To avenge mother and my comrades!

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: But the walls of Kremnos will not fall with me. Do you truly think you can escape fate's grasp, my son?

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: Hahaha... You and I, we're both the same... We feast on strife and fear...

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: ...Now, kill me!

speaker: Old King Eurypon
line: The son of Gorgo is destined to be crowned in blood!

speaker: Mydei
line: Krateros...

speaker: Mydei
line: He said the Grand Craftsman Chartonus might have some suggestions. Might as well go see him.

text: Seek advice from Grand Craftsman Chartonus

speaker: Mydei
line: Grand Craftsman, how have you been?

speaker: Chartonus
line: King of Kremnos, it is. That you would come, I knew.

speaker: Mydei
line: You knew I was coming?

speaker: Chartonus
line: Your matters, I've heard. The path forward, you seek. Many questions, you have.

speaker: Chartonus
line: But before that... Take this.

speaker: Mydei
line: What's this...?

speaker: Chartonus
line: A signet ring. For the king of Kremnos. Belonged to your mother. Recast and restore it... I did.

speaker: Mydei
line: What... Mother threw it into the Sea of Souls...

speaker: Chartonus
line: A long time to fish out, it took. Very fortunate, we were.

speaker: Mydei
line: I can hardly imagine how much patience and courage it must have taken to find such a small signet ring in the Sea of Souls. I owe you one.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Gratitude, there is no need for. Repayment for saving me, this is.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Questions, you bring with you. Ask, now.

speaker: Mydei
line: The fate I've always denied has finally caught up to me.

speaker: Mydei
line: By all rights, I should accept Strife's authority. It would make everyone happy: the Chrysos Heirs, the Council of Elders, the Kremnoans, even the bards who will write it all into song...

speaker: Chartonus
line: Yet hesitate still, you do. Hesitate, why do you, young king?

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Because of my people.

speaker: Mydei
line: Be they men, women, the elderly, or children... the hearts of all Kremnoans yearn for home. They've all been waiting for this day, for the day their king returns.

speaker: Mydei
line: The children of Strife would then be able to go home and embrace the old traditions — never mind that most of them have only ever been heard in these so-called "traditions" in song. They would then gather around their king and throw themselves into battle.

speaker: Chartonus
line: This is not a good thing, you believe.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...The Kremnoans have been trapped in a cycle of bloodshed for the past one thousand years: They seek vengeance, start wars, become prosperous, then decline... How much innocent blood flowed into the River of Souls in all of those years? How many needless sacrifices could we have avoided?

speaker: Mydei
line: If I accept that fate and become the totem of Strife, then lead my people into repeating the same mistakes... then of course I would be terrified. I'd be terrified of becoming king.

speaker: Chartonus
line: A different kind of Kremnoan, you truly are...

text: In order to reconcile the Kremnoans and the Okhemans, Tribbie, Trianne, and Trinnon decided to visit the Titan and retrieve their memories...
